comment.body:
Should we use a non unambiguous date format here? We could use the `date` format as defined in [RFC 2822 ยง 3.3]:

```
date            =       day month year
day             =       ([FWS] 1*2DIGIT) / obs-day
month           =  "Jan"  /  "Feb" /  "Mar"  /  "Apr"
                /  "May"  /  "Jun" /  "Jul"  /  "Aug"
                /  "Sep"  /  "Oct" /  "Nov"  /  "Dec"
year            =       4*DIGIT / obs-year
```

So for instance here: `3 Apr 2024`

[RFC 2822 ยง 3.3]: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt
The existing format is following ISO 8601, at least the YYYY-MM-DD portion of it, which I prefer. It better lends itself to chronological sorting.
If you're talking about just the way it is displayed, I have no strong preference. But as written it is consistent with the date formatting in the filename.
Okay, sgtm then. +1 for the chronological sorting
Personally, I would prefer 03 APR 2024, but 2024-04-03 does make sorting much easier ๐
